top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

“Proposal 3 made changes that weakened the integrity of our election system by allowing people to register and vote without ever being seen in-person,” Sen. Ruth Johnson, a Holly Republican"

"If you’ve never registered in Michigan before, you must go in person to your city or township clerk's office before 8 pm on Election Day and provide a document showing proof of residency" https://mvic.sos.state.mi.us/registervoter

The GOP really needs to stop lying about, well, everything.

Y'all need to help protect Gretchen Whitmer and Tony Evers at all costs. They are the only thing keeping those two states from falling into extremist right-wing rule.

And once those states go all red, say goodbye to future fair elections.
I'm really worried about the future of the US as the whole Republican party has drifted to this crazy behavior.
If you make voter ID laws more restrictive but provide no other path or funding to help people get valid ID, you're suppressing democracy. Simple as that.
